page.title: 01LANCOMBE
page.content:
The Lancombe area of Exmoor is mainly moorland. The average height is 1200 - 1400 feet above sea level. The area has several spurs and also valleys.
The moorland is wet and marshy when situated next to streams. There is an east/west ridge which forms a watershed. The water flows south to the English Channel via the river Exe, and north to the Bristol Channel.
In the area grows cotton grass and Sphagnum bog species. The walled parts are in the south, close to the roads.
It is very hard, if not impossible, to grow anything on this land.
